info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg and northwestern Nottoway Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Abilene, or 7 miles southwest of Hampden Sydney, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hampden Sydney around 310 PM EDT. Hampden Sydney College around 315 PM EDT. Green Bay around 330 PM EDT. Burkeville around 340 PM EDT. Crewe around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Briery Creek Lake, Prince Edward Station, Briery, Twin Lakes State Park, Allens Mill, Nutbush, Burkes Tavern, Scholfield, Moran and Kingsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Virginia.
